benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from bundle

covered: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Success paths covered for removing all, single, and multiple custom fields (TC01–TC05), including with/without optional headers (TC04, TC18).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when bundle does not exist or DB empty (TC07, TC23).
DELETE - Concurrency: Simultaneous requests behavior validated (TC16); ensures race handling for the same field.
Input Validation: Invalid bundleId format and truncated UUID return 400 (TC06, TC22); invalid customField UUID and empty value return 400 (TC09, TC19).
Authorization: 401 for invalid/expired token (TC13); required header enforcement and error on missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy (TC08).
Query Parameters: No parameter removes all; single and multiple parameters supported; extra/unsupported parameter ignored; field not present is no-op with 204 (TC01–TC03, TC10, TC11).
Operational Resilience: 503 service unavailable and 503/504 on dependency degradation handled (TC12, TC24).
Security Hardening: Header injection attempt does not execute and returns error (TC14).
Performance: Deleting many fields completes within SLA (TC15).
Data Consistency/Regression: Unrelated bundles unaffected; post-delete GET reflects expected state; DB consistency checked (TC17, TC25).
gaps: DELETE - Soft Deletes: No test to verify whether deletion is soft vs. hard (e.g., audit flags/history visibility vs. permanent removal).
Idempotency: No explicit scenario deleting the same customField(s) twice sequentially returns 204 and leaves state unchanged.
Authorization - 403: No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user (e.g., lacking permissions/roles) receiving 403.
Server Error Handling: No explicit coverage for generic 5xx (e.g., 500 Internal Server Error due to unexpected backend failure).
Response Headers/Protocol Semantics: No checks for Content-Type, absence of body on 204, or presence of standard headers (e.g., correlation/request-id).
Mixed Valid/Invalid customField IDs: No scenario where the query includes a mix of valid and invalid UUIDs to define expected behavior (reject all vs. partial success).
Duplicate customField parameters: No scenario defining behavior when the same customField appears multiple times.
Large query fan-out: No test deleting a very large list via repeated customField parameters (as opposed to delete-all without parameter).
UUID normalization: No coverage for case-insensitive UUID handling or hyphen-less UUIDs if supported/expected.
recommendations: Add a soft-delete verification scenario: confirm whether fields are hard-deleted or soft-deleted (e.g., verify audit logs/history endpoints and visibility to admins).
Add an idempotency test: delete specific customField(s), repeat the same DELETE, expect 204 both times and unchanged state.
Introduce a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking permissions to validate authorization boundaries.
Add a generic 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB exception) and verify proper error format and stability.
Validate response headers and protocol semantics for 204 responses: ensure no body is returned, verify Content-Type (if any), and standard headers (e.g., request-id).
Test mixed-validity customField parameters: define expected contract (fail-fast with 400 vs. partial deletion with 207/204) and assert behavior.
Add a test for duplicate customField IDs in the query and expected handling (de-duplication/idempotent behavior).
Add a scenario deleting a large list of explicit customField UUIDs via multi query params to validate limits and performance.
Add UUID normalization tests (uppercase/lowercase handling, hyphen-less if applicable) to clarify accepted formats.
